je t'aime。
la lenguas ╱ love you all the time
. . . ⇢ ˗ˏˋ ╱ the body

Angelina was raised by the closest thing you could get to hippies without the ganja and 70s aesthetics. Riding on familial wealth, the Danilovas led a nomadic lifestyle—via a renovated school bus or wherever a plane took them. Moving from city to city, country to country, Angelina and her older brother were allowed to do pretty much everything they wanted outside of mandatory home school attendance.

When Angelina wanted to learn horseback riding, she was signed up for lessons. When she wanted to have class on the beach 10 minutes from their, then, home, they did. She could certainly be considered spoiled, but she rarely had big asks and was never a brat when she was told no. It did, however, prove to be a major adjustment curve when the Danilova children were forced into an entirely different lifestyle.

(tw: fatal car accident, injury, and alcoholism mention)

Angelina and her brother were 9 and 12, respectively, when their parents died in a car accident. It was a hit and run by a drunk driver that sent the Danilova family car careening into a ditch. Angelina and her brother had been there but miraculously got away with comparatively minor injuries. A broken arm here, a busted leg there, some internal injuries, and cuts, gashes, and scrapes for days—but they were alive.

The siblings were shipped off to the nearest relatives once they recovered enough for travel back to Russia and these relatives were a far cry from their free-willed parents. They were strict, close-minded, and had concocted their ideas for the siblings' futures within a month of them living there. Every extra curricular activity during middle and high school was joined at the will of Angelina's aunt and uncle. It would all look amazing on her applications and resumes—and it did! But it also made for an unhappy teenager who was all too glad to move away to uni when the time came.

Angelina went on to study aerospace engineering in uni, having always been fascinated by the field, but she actually quit her post-grad internship early on when years of feeling stifled finally boiled over. It was terrible timing for her aerospace career, but Angelina is pragmatic and strong-willed. She carved out an alternative path for herself, opening up to the world of freelance and gig work after a handful of certification courses and, in other cases, some old-fashioned practice/trial and error. Now, she makes a living through her artistic passions: interior design, set design, visual art, photography, and videography. 

. . . ⇢ ˗ˏˋ ╱ the soul

Angelina is a bright, bubbly social butterfly but she definitely needs her time to decompress and be alone at the end of the day. She can easily spend days holed up alone in her room, working on whatever the current project is, but relishes in social time. Despite being a little off the wall, she's quite intelligent and loves learning, but is only interested in it on her own terms. Any structure, really, feels too stifling for her and she prefers to just come and go as she pleases—be it with a new interest or a living situation. To mitigate this and to keep from having to break and make leases out the ass every time the "move!!" bug bites, she just does a lot of traveling.  

Likes: dogs, sunshowers, the color orange, earth tones, sitcoms, history video essays, thrift stores, sci-fi and high & urban fantasy aesthetics, jelly candy, fresh fruits, and salty foods

Dislikes: wearing dresses, driving, and loud noises

Hobbies: singing, ukulele, drawing/painting, scrolling through house photo tour sites, binging YouTube, visiting museums, photography, snowboarding, and camping

Spoken Languages: Russian, Korean, English, Serbian, and Italian 

. . . ⇢ ˗ˏˋ ╱ the heart
